body:
<!-- Please only use this template for submitting reports about flaky tests or jobs (pass or fail with no underlying change in code) in Kubernetes CI -->

**Which jobs are flaking**:

The unit test `TestVolumeBinding`

**Which test(s) are flaking**:

```
--- FAIL: TestVolumeBinding (0.71s)
    --- FAIL: TestVolumeBinding/bound_and_unbound_unsatisfied (0.10s)
        volume_binding_test.go:282: call PreFilter and check status
        volume_binding_test.go:291: check state after prefilter phase
        volume_binding_test.go:299: call Filter and check status
        volume_binding_test.go:302: filter status does not match: &{1 [could not find v1.PersistentVolume "pv-a"]}, want: &{3 [node(s) had volume node affinity conflict node(s) didn't find available persistent volumes to bind]}
FAIL
```

**Testgrid link**:

**Reason for failure**:

In volume scheduling, we maintain internal caches that watch for PV/PVC events. However, we don't have a method to wait for them to be synced in UT. 

When the cache in the informer factory is synced but the execution of registered handlers may not finish.

<!--
In production, this is not a problem. Even if the scheduler marks the pod uncacheable due to the stale cache in PVAssumeCache/PVCAssumeCache, the pod will be moved to the active queue later as the scheduler [will move unschedulable pods to the active queue if they are not retried for more than 1 minute](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/72558).

related:

- https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/73305
- https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/72558

-->

**Anything else we need to know**:
- links to go.k8s.io/triage appreciated
- links to specific failures in spyglass appreciated

title: The unit test TestVolumeBinding is flaky
